node.title: Sodden month a sign of drenchings to come as La Niña makes herself at home
node.alt: A 75-year-old woman standing in the front yard of a home behind a pile of debris from the flood.
node.description: After years of drought, a mouse plague and near-biblical deluges, Australia's wettest November has many wondering what's next for parts of the country already saturated.
node.content:
["Blair Charlton knows about storm recovery \u2013 she won an award for\u00a0her part in the New Orleans clean-up\u00a0after Hurricane Katrina \u2013 but there's something about the floods that swept across northern New South Wales this week she finds especially challenging.\u00a0\u00a0", "It's the stink,\u00a0says\u00a0the\u00a075-year-old as she drags damp and splintered furniture and house fittings to\u00a0her sodden Gunnedah yard.", "\"Aside from\u00a0writing off my garden I've worked two years on, there's now the stench,\" she said,.", "\"The poor chickens \u2014 I had to wade down the [yard] to get them out. I could see a couple float away.", "\"Their bodies are still down there. I haven't had the heart to look yet.\"", "Ms Charlton and her Gunnedah neighbours are accustomed to dust in their homes after years of low rainfall in the state's north-east\u00a0but that changed in a near-biblical way last week as\u00a0Australia's wettest November on record\u00a0culminated in extraordinary rain totals across the eastern states.", "Floodwaters destroyed at least 20 homes in Gunnedah and damaged up to 100 as the\u00a0Namoi River\u00a0reached a peak of 8.61 metres, surpassing the 1974 flood record of 8.53 metres.", "", "
Gunnedah has received almsot 150mm of rain in the past week.\u00a0(Amy Burling)
", "After a stormy, wet and cool start to spring that delivered intense supercell hail storms, flash flooding\u00a0alerts\u00a0and\u00a0overflowing dams from Tasmania to South Australia and Queensland, it was no surprise when the Bureau of Meteorology\u00a0on November 23 officially declared this would be another La Ni\u00f1a summer.", "Then\u00a0the rain really\u00a0set in and,\u00a0in parts of NSW and Queensland, did not stop for days.\u00a0", "Maryborough, in Queensland's Wide Bay region, broke a 152-year record with 310\u00a0millimetres of rain for the month\u00a0while central Queensland cattle property\u00a0Carnarvon station received 356 millimetres \u2014\u00a0the most recorded there in November for 70 years.", "The downpours caused widespread flooding in areas that until recently were in drought.", "Reddish-brown water entered homes and businesses along Queensland-New South Wales border country, with residents of Inglewood, Toomelah and Boggabilla ordered to evacuate in the past week.", "Just as farmers were about to bring in crops worth celebrating,\u00a0the deluge\u00a0submerged them, forcing some growers to revert to hand picking where it was too wet to harvest with machinery.\u00a0", "", "
The floods have filled Gunnedah with mud and mosquitoes.(ABC New England North West: Kemii Maguire)
", "
La Ni\u00f1a's storming\u00a0encore
", "It's eastern Australia's second summer in a row to be dominated by La Ni\u00f1a, the system\u00a0associated with wetter-than-average conditions\u00a0for northern and eastern Australia\u00a0and the\u00a0Bureau of\u00a0Meteorology is expecting it to\u00a0persist until at least January, meaning the already-soaked regions could be in for more heavy rains.", "And the extreme start to the season has\u00a0caught the attention of climate watchers.\u00a0", "University of Southern Queensland climate scientist Christa Pudmenzky\u00a0said the conditions were reminiscent of climate patterns in 2010-2011, which resulted in devastating\u00a0floods, with multiple fatalities\u00a0in southern Queensland.", "\"This event is not as severe as 2010-2011,\" Dr Pudmenzky\u00a0said.", "\"But it is important to keep an eye on it.", "", "
Large areas of eastern Australia have received rainfall totals of 100 millimetres or more in the past week.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "But in disheartening news for regions just coming out of drought, she said there was no guarantee of continuing rains after January.", "\"At the moment,\u00a0everything is wet but ... maybe next year or a year after, we might slowly go back into drought,\" Dr Pudmenzky\u00a0said.", "\"We always have to be prepared for the future.\"", "World\u00a0Meteorological Association climatologist Roger Stone told the ABC more research was urgently needed into how climate change would affect future\u00a0La Ni\u00f1a\u00a0and El\u00a0Ni\u00f1o systems.", "\"We really need to know more about how those systems are going to interact before we can tie down what the future's going to be for Australia,\" he said.", "
Dam inflows\u00a0inconsistent
", "Dams across the New England North West region in NSW are full to overflowing and\u00a0SES Western Zone superintendent Mitch Parker said water releases were\u00a0being closely monitored.", "\"Previously we had some reserves for those catchments in those dams\u00a0and, unfortunately, we don't have that anymore,\" he said.", "\"We're working with Water New South Wales and keeping a close eye on those.\"", "Coolmunda Dam, near Inglewood in southern Queensland,\u00a0where evacuation orders were issued last weekend, was still spilling megalitres late this week.", "", "
Monthly rainfall totals for Australia in November\u00a02021\u00a0showing parts of eastern Australia received more than 300mm.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "But it's a different story on the other side of the Great Dividing Range for south-east Queensland's\u00a0largest water storage, Wivenhoe Dam, which is only at 40 per cent capacity, up from\u00a0about 35 per cent capacity in September.", "Toowoomba Mayor Paul Antonio said he was concerned about the region's water security, with rainfall missing the major catchments.", "\"There is a problem with future water for this broader area.\"", "", "
Monthly rainfall totals for Australia in November 2020\u00a0show a significantly drier picture.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "
From drought to flood
", "Rainfall totals in\u00a0Queensland's Wide Bay-Burnett region indicate\u00a0an easing of drought conditions, according to the BOM, with some areas\u00a0receiving\u00a0more than triple their monthly average in November.\u00a0The Goondiwindi region, which includes Inglewood, only had its drought status revoked in May\u00a0after seven years.", "Mayor Lawrence Springborg said it was confronting to now be dealing with floods.", "\"It's been quite extreme,\" he said.", "", "
In the past six months, Gunnedah resident Lauren Mackley has experienced a new baby, a pandemic, a mouse plague, and a flood.(ABC New England North West: Kemii Maguire)
", "
'Massive' clean-up underway
", "Residents in the affected areas now face the daunting job of cleaning up after floods, many rushing to remove the mud from their homes before it sets hard.", "Lauren Mackley\u00a0moved to Gunnedah with her husband Dion six months ago and in that time has had a baby and renovated her house, while dealing with a pandemic, mouse plague\u00a0and,\u00a0now, the flood.", "Their newly renovated house has\u00a0mud shin-deep on its floors but Ms Mackley is not complaining.", "", "
This Gunnedah home has a\u00a0foot of mud on its floors.(Supplied: Dion Betts)
", "\"You know this will happen when you buy into a flood plain. I just thought I had more time,\" she said.", "\"It was petrifying.\"", "Homes across town quickly became overcrowded\u00a0as people sought emergency accommodation.", "\"Ten of us were sleeping at my sister's place. We'd already been there for a week\u00a0and then the big floods came through,\"\u00a0Ms Mackley said.", "\"It was heartbreaking. We knew there was no saving [our place]. We just had a massive clean-up on our hands.\"", "SES Western Division\u00a0used new software to track and record the damage caused by the Namoi River flooding.", "A spokesperson told the ABC it would store information for when the next major rain event happened\u00a0in the region.", "
Life after flood
", "Meanwhile, Blair Charlton is trying to remain sunny in the aftermath of all the rain.", "\"I've learnt that there is life beyond the flood,\" Ms Charlton\u00a0said.", "Ms Charlton, who was visiting family in New Orleans in 2005 when Hurricane Katrina hit and spent six months with the Red Cross recovery effort, had\u00a0a service medal awarded to her by the city for her contributions.", "Despite her experience and stoic response, Ms Charlton said the Gunnedah flood was devastating and she was getting\u00a0through it by thinking about a future that was drier, but not too dry."]
